alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 20 at 8:38PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Along the Middle Loup River in parts of Sherman County, particularly between the Loup City and Rockville areas. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding along low-lying pasture land immediately adjacent to the river is expected. Also expect areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 822 PM CST, Thursday, an automated gauge near Rockville indicated an ice jam in the area, with the river level fluctuating near the minor flood stage of 8.5 feet. Minor flooding along the river in the Rockville area was also confirmed by local emergency management. - Because the short-term behavior of ice jams can be very difficult to predict, those with interests along the Middle Loup River should closely monitor water levels, as continued fluctuations are likely. An extension-in-time of this Warning is possible if the ice jam does not break up by late Friday afternoon. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... locations immediately along the Middle Loup River in parts of Sherman County. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
